subject: Politics
title: Buffer States
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Buffer States.

hook.text: Mongolia sits between Russia and China. Its survival depends on neither side wanting it badly enough to fight.

buildup.text: Buffer states are small countries located between rival great powers. They absorb tension like geopolitical cushions.

discovery.text: Belgium was created in 1830 as a buffer between France and the German states. It didn't prevent two world wars.

twist.text: Ukraine was Russia's buffer against NATO. When Ukraine moved westward, Russia invaded to prevent the shift.

climax.text: Buffer states face impossible choices: lean toward one power and anger the other, or stay neutral and hope.

punchline.text: Buffer states exist at others' mercy. Their peace depends on others' restraint.

quiz.question: Why was Belgium created in 1830?
options: As a buffer state between France and the German states
To serve as the European capital
To control North Sea trade routes
